Try using the -noloading flag.  I haven't checked, but perhaps
the textui package uses the default class loader.

   String[] testCaseName = {"-noloading", LoginTest.class.getName()};

-----Original Message-----
From: dchong@... [mailto:dchong@...]
Sent: Wednesday, March 14, 2001 11:23 AM
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Subject: [junit] JUnit works in TextUI but not in SwingUI or AWTUI


I have a problem with JUnit that I cannot rectify.  I have a TestCase 
that will execute fine if I run TestRunner under the textui package. 
If I try to run TestRunner thru the swingui or awtui packages, the 
test fails with the same exceptions.  It would seem like I have a 
conflict somehow with Persistence initializing but I don't have this 
problem under the textui. Here is the code in main so you can see how 
I'm making a simple change to use the various TestRunner's. Only the 
last one works.

public static void main(String args[]) { 
    	String[] testCaseName = {LoginTest.class.getName()}; 
        //junit.swingui.TestRunner.main(testCaseName);
        //junit.awtui.TestRunner.main(testCaseName);
    	junit.textui.TestRunner.main(testCaseName);
        
                     
	}

Here is the exception stack trace:  
java.lang.IllegalStateException: java.lang.ClassCastException: 
com.objectEra.jbroker.transaction.TSIdentificationImpl

	at com.persistence.client.internal.ServicesRepClient.init
(ServicesRepClient.java)

	at

(IResourceFactory.java:49)

	at com.iknowledgeinc.cxd.lineup.LineupCXDFactory.createCXD
(LineupCXDFactory.java:60)

	at lineup.tests.LoginTest.setUp(LoginTest.java:28)

Code)

	at junit.swingui.TestRunner$18.run(TestRunner.java:634)

java.lang.IllegalStateException: getORB: ServicesRepClient is not 
initialized

	at com.persistence.client.internal.ServicesRepClient.getORB
(ServicesRepClient.java)

	at com.persistence.client.Services.getORB(Services.java)

	at com.iknowledgeinc.resource.rmi.IResourceRmi.setProperties
(IResourceRmi.java:117)

	at com.iknowledgeinc.resource.IResourceFactory.create
(IResourceFactory.java:49)

	at com.iknowledgeinc.cxd.lineup.LineupCXDFactory.createCXD
(LineupCXDFactory.java:60)

	at lineup.tests.LoginTest.setUp(LoginTest.java:28)

	at junit.framework.TestCase.runBare(TestCase.java:128)

	at junit.framework.TestResult$1.protect(TestResult.java:106)

	at junit.framework.TestResult.runProtected
(TestResult.java:124)

	at junit.framework.TestResult.run(TestResult.java:109)

	at junit.framework.TestCase.run(TestCase.java:121)

	at junit.framework.TestSuite.runTest(TestSuite.java:157)

	at junit.framework.TestSuite.run(TestSuite.java, Compiled 
Code)

	at junit.swingui.TestRunner$18.run(TestRunner.java:634)


Can anyone offer any advice?  I have tried manipulating my classpath 
by changing the order of my jar files all with no luck.  It always 
works under textui but never in swingui or awtui.

thanks

Dave
